title: Celebrity Guest Editors Shape Holiday Radio Programming
summary: BBC Radio 4's Today programme is featuring six notable public figures as guest editors over the Christmas period, from December 24 to 31. This annual tradition, now in its 22nd year, allows individuals like Oscar-winning actress Cate Blanchett and former prime minister Baroness Theresa May to curate content on diverse topics. Blanchett's segment will address AI's impact on women in film, refugee crises, sustainability in fashion, and the benefits of gardening. Other editors include Melvyn Bragg discussing the nativity story and mental health, Sir James Dyson on entrepreneurship and dementia research, Mustafa Suleyman on artificial super intelligence, Tom Holland on England's history and AI in academia, and Theresa May on domestic violence and trust in politics. The programme's editor, Owenna Griffiths, emphasizes that these guests bring illumination and fresh perspectives to help listeners understand a changing world, fostering joy and new ideas during the holidays.
